column1: Gloversville is a city in the Mohawk Valley region of Upstate New York
column2: and the most populous city in Fulton County. Gloversville was once the hub of the United States' glovemaking industry
column3: with over two hundred manufacturers in Gloversville and the adjacent city of Johnstown. In 2010

column1: Settlers came to the Gloversville area as early as 1752.The region
column2: historically known as "Kingsborough"
column3: was acquired by Sir William Johnson
column5: who established tremendous influence with the Native Americans of the area
column6: which translated into control of the  Mohawk Valley region.  It was due to Johnson that the Six Nations Iroquois Confederacy remained allied with English during the French and Indian War.  In reward
column7: Johnson was granted the Kingsborough Tract
column8: a large parcel of land which was settled by   TScottish Highlanders.  The Highlanders were so loyal to Johnson that when he died in 1774
column9: they followed his son to Canada.In 1752
column10: Arent Stevens purchased land in the area. Puritans from New England settled there at the end of the 18th century
column11: utilizing the houses and cleared land that had been left behind when the Highlanders immigrated.  By 1803
column13: the population of Kingsborough consisted of "233 families and about 1
column17: fourteen Dutch and five Irish."In 1852 Gloversville had a population of 1
column18: 318 living on 525 acres in 250 smal wood frame houses centered on the "Four Corners" formed by the intersection of Main and Fulton Streets.  The proximity of hemlock forests to supply bark for tanning made the community a center of leather production early in its history: there were already 40 small glove and mitten factories there by 1852.  The city would become the center of the American glovemaking industry for many years. From 1890–1950
column19: 90% of all gloves sold in the United States were made in Gloversville.Upon the establishment of a United States post office in 1828
column20: "Gloversville" became the official name of the community. Prior to that Gloversville had been known as "Stump City" because of the large number of trees that had been cut down. In 1853
column21: Gloversville incorporated as a village. In 1853 it incorporated as a village
column22: and then in 1890 as a city.  The city grew rapidly
column25: 864 in 1890.Glove-making operations changed from being home-based to being factory-based

column1: Glove-making operations had gradually changed from being home-based to being factory-based
column2: and large tanneries and glove shops employed nearly 80% of the residents of Gloversville area. Home workers sewed the gloves from leather that had been cut in factories. Related businesses
column5: and thread dealers opened to serve the industry.

column2: Gloversville had a very active electric interurban line

column9: and into downtown Schenectady to the New York Central station. In 1932
column10: in a bold move during the Great Depression it acquired unique bullet cars in an attempt to revive the economy. Freight operation continued through this era. Gloversville also became the main headquarters for the Schine movie industry in the mid-20th century.Following the Great Depression
column11: the decline of the glove industry left the city financially depressed with many downtown storefronts abandoned and store windows covered with plywood. Many houses were abandoned when people moved out of town to find jobs elsewhere. The city's population peaked at 23
column12: 634 in 1950 and had since fallen to 15

column1: The city sits in the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains and therefore is within a climatic transition zone. Gloversville experiences the warmer summer temperatures common throughout the Capital Region
column2: Hudson Valley
column3: and Mohawk Valley while experiencing generally more copious precipitation throughout the year than the Capital Region. This manifests in commonplace rolling thunderstorms throughout the summer months and snowfall amounts more akin to the lake-pocked higher elevations of the Adirondacks in the winter months.

column2: less than 30% of Gloversville professes religious affiliation as of 2020. The largest religious group in Gloversville and its area is Christianity
column3: mainly served by the Roman Catholic
column7: and Episcopal churches. Conservative evangelical churches in the area are the Southern Baptist Convention and Assemblies of God. The second largest religious group is Judaism

column1: The city of Gloversville was once a major center for the glovemaking industry in the United States. Since the Great Depression
column2: the city has struggled with a declining population
column5: and violent crime. During the late 2010s and early 2020
column6: the city has proposed numerous economic redevelopment plans to stem its decline.

column1: Gloversville falls almost entirely within the Gloversville Enlarged School District
column2: with small portions of the city falling within Broadalbin-Perth
column4: and Greater Johnstown School Districts. Nearly all of Gloversville ESD's schools are within city limits
column5: with the exception of Meco Elementary
column6: which is in the Town of Johnstown within 0.5 miles (0.80 km) of the city's western border. Boulevard Elementary School is partially within the city and partially within the Town of Johnstown. Nearby Fulton–Montgomery Community College is located in the City of Johnstown.

column2: performing 88 times at the Metropolitan Opera in New York City
column3: and singing alongside Plácido Domingo in the starring roles of eight different operas including Aida
column4: Tannhauser and Don Giovanni.  She also performed leading soprano roles at major opera houses in Berlin
column6: London and Japan.  After her performing career ended she became a professor of voice at Westminster Choir College of Rider University in Philadelphia. Her students have sung with major opera companies across the United States.

column1: Gloversville contains two historic districts listed on the National Register of Historic Places (NRHP):
Downtown Gloversville Historic District - Primarily on North and South Mains Street and East and West Fulton Stree
Kingsboro Historic District - A small district consisting of the houses which face Veterans Park
